protocol_name: Transformation of Phaeodactylum tricornutum by electroporation
protocol_name_html: Transformation of Phaeodactylum tricornutum by electroporation
link: Zhang, C., & Hu, H. (2014). High-efficiency nuclear transformation of the diatom Phaeodactylum tricornutum by electroporation. Marine genomics, 16, 63-66.
description: Successful transformation of Phaeodactylum tricornutum (CMP632) by electroporation was achieved based on a modified version of Zhang & Hu (2014).
before_start:
Materials needed for transformation                                                  

  • 375 mM Sorbitol, filter sterilize and store at -20°C.
  • Plasmid DNA --> linearize with ScaI at 37°C (5’…AGT|ACT… 3’) (3’…TCA|TGA…5’)
  • Salmon sperm dna-->  denature the DNA by boiling for 1 minute, then place on ice
  • f/2 medium + Si
  • solid medium (50% ASW containing f/2 nutrients, 1.2% agar + zeocin 75 µg/ml)

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Strain and culture conditions
components.name: Section

components.data: P. tricornutum (CCMP632) cells were grown axenically in f/2 + Si medium at 22°C and illuminated with 75 μmol photons m− 2s− 1, 12L:12D. For growth on solid medium, cultures were grown on 50% ASW containing f/2 nutrients, 1.2% agar.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: P. tricornutum (CCMP632) cells were grown axenically in f/2 + Si medium at 22°C and illuminated with 75 μmol photons m− 2s− 1, 12L:12D. For growth on solid medium, cultures were grown on 50% ASW containing f/2 nutrients, 1.2% agar.

components.data: Plasmid
components.name: Section

components.data: pPha-T1/eGFP: carries the bleomycin-resistant gene (sh ble) under the fcpB promoter and eGFP gene (egfp) under the fcpA promoter.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: pPha-T1/eGFP: carries the bleomycin-resistant gene (sh ble) under the fcpB promoter and eGFP gene (egfp) under the fcpA promoter.

pPhaT1 GenBank accession: AF219942, [Zaslavskaia et al. (2000). Transformation of the diatom Phaeodactylum tricornutum (Bacillariophyceae) with a variety of selectable marker and reporter genes. Journal of Phycology, 36, 379-386]

components.data: Prepare linearized plasmid DNA
components.name: Section

components.data: Digest ~6 µg of pPha-T1/eGFP with ScaI for 2.5 hours. Then purify linearized plasmid (i.e. Macherey-Nagel Nucleo-Spin gel and PCR clean-up kit).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Digest ~6 µg of pPha-T1/eGFP with ScaI for 2.5 hours. Then purify linearized plasmid (i.e. Macherey-Nagel Nucleo-Spin gel and PCR clean-up kit).

components.data: Grow P. tricornutum to a cell density of 5 × 106 cells/ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Grow P. tricornutum to a cell density of 5 × 106 cells/ml.

components.data: Electroporation of cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Harvest a total of 2 × 108cells by centrifuging at 1500 g for 10 min at 4°C. Remove medium.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Harvest a total of 2 × 108cells by centrifuging at 1500 g for 10 min at 4°C. Remove medium.

components.data: Electroporation of cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Chill a 0.2 cm electroporation cuvette on ice.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Chill a 0.2 cm electroporation cuvette on ice.

components.data: Electroporation of cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Wash cells three times with 1 ml 375 mM sorbitol (sterile and ice cold). If needed, spin between washes at 1500 g for 1-2 mins at 4°C. Before third wash, transfer cells to a 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube, perform final sorbitol wash and then resuspend washed cells in 100 μl 375 mM sorbitol to a final density of 2 × 109cells/ml.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Wash cells three times with 1 ml 375 mM sorbitol (sterile and ice cold). If needed, spin between washes at 1500 g for 1-2 mins at 4°C. Before third wash, transfer cells to a 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube, perform final sorbitol wash and then resuspend washed cells in 100 μl 375 mM sorbitol to a final density of 2 × 109cells/ml.

components.data: Electroporation of cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Mix 100 μl aliquot of resuspended cells with 4 μg (0.2 μg/μl) of linearized plasmid DNA and 40 μg (10 μg/μl) of denatured salmon sperm DNA.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Mix 100 μl aliquot of resuspended cells with 4 μg (0.2 μg/μl) of linearized plasmid DNA and 40 μg (10 μg/μl) of denatured salmon sperm DNA.

components.data: Electroporation of cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Incubate cells/linearized plasmid/salmon sperm DNA mixture on ice for 10 min, then transfer to the 0.2 cm electroporation cuvette.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate cells/linearized plasmid/salmon sperm DNA mixture on ice for 10 min, then transfer to the 0.2 cm electroporation cuvette.

components.data: Electroporation of cells
components.name: Section

components.data:
Adjust Electroporation System to exponential decay and set the following parameters:

500 V field strength

25 μF capacitance

400 Ohm shunt resistance
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Adjust Electroporation System to exponential decay and set the following parameters:

500 V field strength

25 μF capacitance

400 Ohm shunt resistance

components.data: Electroporation of cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Electroporation of cells
components.name: Section

components.data: After electroporation, immediately transfer cells to 15-ml conical Falcon tubes containing 10 ml f/2 medium. Allow cells to recover by incubating in low light (~ 30 μmol photons m− 2s−1) for 24 hours before adding antibiotic selection. Incubate under normal culturing conditions for 24 hours then collect cells by centrifuging at 1500 g for 10 min and resuspending cells in 0.6 ml f/2 medium. Plate serial dilutions onto solid medium containing 75 μg/ml zeocin.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: After electroporation, immediately transfer cells to 15-ml conical Falcon tubes containing 10 ml f/2 medium. Allow cells to recover by incubating in low light (~ 30 μmol photons m− 2s−1) for 24 hours before adding antibiotic selection. Incubate under normal culturing conditions for 24 hours then collect cells by centrifuging at 1500 g for 10 min and resuspending cells in 0.6 ml f/2 medium. Plate serial dilutions onto solid medium containing 75 μg/ml zeocin.

components.data: Electroporation of cells
components.name: Section

components.data: Colonies should start appearring after about 12-14 days.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Colonies should start appearring after about 12-14 days.
